reviewText:
Early Access Review

Fast, fun, smooth, and pretty, albeit too lean for its own good, Paranautical Activity is a fusion of old-school FPS and the ever-popular roguelike genre. Having a speedy, arcade-style shooter in a day and age where slow and steady is the way to go is always a welcome sight. The controls are confusing at first, given that the only way to learn them is through the launcher's configuration menu, but once you've got them down the game leaves you to your own designs. The rooms themselves are simple, having stairs, pits, tunnels, exploding barrels, and/or lava, but the types of enemies and number of them are just right to give the player a balance of control and chaos, while staying fresh each time around. There's also a lineup of high-octane Drum and Bass songs to run while you play, although they're knd of grating, and sometimes you get a few seconds of silence while the tracks are switching.

While the combat in Paranautical Activity is great, the loadouts you get are rather disappointing. You choose package that includes a primary weapon with infinite ammo, a secondary weapon with limited ammo, and a number of stats including health, speed, and damage, although the concept of loadouts like this isn't exactly a nice one. There are no RPG elements either, aside from the various buffs and weapons you find in the game proper, so permadeath sets you back at square one. This isn't a big problem, but it really limits the replay value once you hit the difficulty curve.

And from here inlies the biggest problem with Paranautical Activity: it feels very lean. Almost unfinished. There isn't much in the way of sound design, and despite the gorgeous visual style, particle system, and lighting, the game suffers from a lot of emptiness, even for a roguelike. After about an hour and a number of deaths, you feel like you've seen everything this game has to offer. Games like Binding of Issac have a plot and a sense of humor to keep you hooked. Games like Rogue Legacy have broad RPG elements and randomized perks to keep you hooked. This game doesn't really have anything. Even unlockable weapons would be welcome.

Paranautical Activity is a good game with moments of real fun, and it scratches an itch that modern FPS games outright refuse to scratch. I want more out of this game, but it wears out on you about an hour in. If you and your wallet can justify an hour's worth of  gameplay that's fun and unique, then by all means pick up this game. It's an exercise in genre hybridization, but also in missed potential.

reviewText: 32 minutes was all I could take. I felt the game was clunky and the randomly generated map/rooms didn't seem to mix anything up. This game is a roguelike shooter, meaning that you enter a room, shoot everything that moves, collect coins and move to the next room. You use coins to buy new gear from shops, was it bombs, upgrades or weapons. I hate that the description of this game boasts with big names like Doom (this game lacks the atmosphere), Quake (you run fast, is it enough?), Binding of Isaac (because there are separate rooms, really?) and Spelunky (wait, what?). Paranautical Activity is similar to Serious Sam as you enter an area and kill everything in it, then repeat. It's roguelike in a way that if you die you start from the beginning. And as I started ranting I must warn everyone that these minecraftian graphics may cause headache because of the fast twitchlike movement. Did it for me.\n\nEdit: Nothing changed in the full release. Only thing we know is that also the maker of this game is an idiot.

reviewText:
If this was the pre-death-threats-to-GabeN version of this game, I would tell you to buy it immmidately, but that is no longer the case. The game at some point had an update that added two things that ruined the game for me: Slipery movement, and cringe-worty in-game achievements.

By slipery movement, I mean that when you let go of the movement key, you keep moving about a foot untill you stop. 1 Foot may not seem like much, but being that platforms and catwalks are only about 6-feet accross in this game, it ain't a pleasant feature. Couple that with one third of the framerate of Minecraft (I can run MC at 60, this game at 25, dropping down into single digits) and you have a very rage-inducing combo.

Cringe-worth eh? Padded: Tampon picture, Heh Heh Heh: 69, ParaNUT, stupid pun, you get the idea. Now that I look at it, I'm nitpicking at the names, but answer me this: Why did the game need achievements in the first place? Is such a short (Per playthrough) game not interesting enough without them?

IMO; Get one of these instead, they both are far better games: http://store.steampowered.com/app/266110/

AND/OR

http://store.steampowered.com/app/211260/

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Despite the great music and interesting visuals, this has not been a fun game for me to play.

It should be called Bunny-Hop Activity, because if you're going to survive you will be jumping around way more than is either fun or comfortable.

The concept of a bullet-hell FPS with perma-death, randomly-generated floors and item drops sounds great, but the execution here is really rough.  The bullet-hell is way too difficult to be fun for anyone less than a pro FPS player.

Also, I they might think they're being cool by not telling you what the items do, and experimenting to see what is what would normally be okay with me, but it is totally unfeasible when you can almost NEVER get enough money to buy items, making experimenting really slow and unrewarding.  That, on top of the fact that most items have nearly un-observable passive effects that make figuring them our nigh-on impossible.  Couple that with the usable" items and "super weapons" being unable to use until you go to Google to figure out which key does what
date: because you're given NO INSTRUCTION OF ANY KIND EVER.\n\nI understand learning by experimentation
recommended: and games not taking you by the hand

reviewText:
-OH WOW THIS REVIEW HAS HAD MORE ITERATIONS THAN FINAL FANTASY MAYBE YOU SHOULD READ IT IN ITS ENTIRETY-

Developers are rude and insulting to their customers, and the game is slowly picking up bugs when it should be losing them.

The game itself is really quite enjoyable for people who're into fast-paced arena-shooter type games, although it doesn't have the replay value of most action-roguelikes such as The Binding of Isaac.

I'd give it a 7/10, although considering the attitude of the developers, the lying about features, and the increasing incompetence of the game's coding, I would regrettably have to advise against purchasing this.

EDIT: As of October 2014 the dev team seem to be stepping up on taking community feedback and listening to the playerbase's concerns. I may change this review to recommend the game if this continues.

EDIT the Second: I'd advise you to not buy this game as of late October 2014, as you literally cannot purchase it any longer. Thanks SpooderW.

EDIT the Third: aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaand it's back, let's see where it goes from here.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Paranautical Activity is a very fast paced roguelike shooter. The combat feels like Quake on speed in much smaller, but well designed rooms (with enough room to bunny hop around while dodging enemy fire and shooting back).
The enemies are nice and varied, and weapons are fun to use.
In a nutshell, this is a mixture of the shooting mechanics of quake with the roguelike elements of Binding of Isaac.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Gameplay is just like Serious Sam: Walk into room. All enemies either run at you or start shooting slow projectiles. Kill them all. Repeat.

One key difference is that the enemies are dead silent, rather dimly lit, and deal a lot of damage. When you walk into a new room, you can easily run backwards into a 12 foot high Satan and lose three hearts in an instant. You would think that this would make the game unplayable, but the number of different room layouts is so small that you will start remembering enemy spawn locations after a couple games.

Since the game is rogue-like, it is really tempting to play round after round in order to see new items. However, few items really change how the game is played. You are going to be running backward holding down your left mouse button a lot.

I only got as far as the floor where swastikas start appearing on walls and tiny fast moving raptors run at you (6th? 8th? I don't remember). That is when I realized I would have to memorize a whole new area of layouts, and that I had stopped having fun four hours ago.

Could it appeal to some people? Maybe. Could it improve? Maybe. I would not recommend buying it now.

reviewText:
DO NOT BUT THIS GAME.

this is literally one of the worst games i've ever played in my life.

the aesthetics are universally offensive. graphics are hideous, enemy and weapon designs are laughable, music is eardrum-bludgeoning garbage. the weapons themselves are horribly unfun to use, with no sense of weight to them and no sense that they are inflicting damage on anything you aim them with. every audio asset in this game is stolen. enemies don't even react when you shoot them, whether it be with a crossbow or a grenade launch. even wolf3d and doom gave you enough feedback that it felt like you were firing weapons that damaged the target, something that this title has completely failed to do. all of this might have been forgivable if the game was in any way enjoyable to play, but to top everything else off it also controls like steaming garbage. you move like a greased pig on ice skates and the limited field of view and terrible movement guarantees that you will get hung up on the slightest obstacle in your path.

the real crime here isn't that this game was yanked from greenlight, it's that it was ever allowed on steam to begin with, and i sincerely regret that even a single cent of my money has gone into the developers' pockets.

EDIT: since i have written this, this game has been taken off steam because Mike SpooderW" Maulbeck threatened to murder Gabe Newell on Twitter. at this point this miserable software abortion was removed from steam and Maulbeck resigned from code avarice. except code avarice hired him again and sold this garbage heap to another publisher to get it back on Steam. do not pay for this game. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.

DOUBLE EDIT: I have been permabanned from this game's forums lmfao.

TRIPLE EDIT: I have been unbanned. This game is still bad."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So I gave this game a review during Early Access and it was bad. Really bad. I have reconsidered my position after retrying the game a few months later when the game had more updates, features, achievements and now even cards and secondary weapons (ninja-to, ♥♥♥♥♥es!). It seems like devs are actually working on making this a better game.

It's not as bad as it used to be BUT I still dislike it. However, it do deserves a nice grade, this is just not my kind of game. The few classes you can choose are super unbalanced and it's a miracle if you can find a weapon that shoots actual bullets and not colorful balls of slugness or mega slow darts. Don't even let me get started on how super fast you die with any class that is not the heavy. I understand the mechanics of rogue-like dungeon crawlers and I have played a few, yes, but this one? You just die too fast.

If you have the patience for fast paced, rogue-like, one hit death, dubstep themed games, do give this a try. It won't hurt your pocket and you can even kill Poseidon! I just did!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Great idea, poorly executed. Sure, it's an Early Access game, but it has a long road ahead of it, mostly in usability.

The controls feel very floaty; you have momentum as you move, which is never a good thing in an FPS. There's no descriptions saying what any of the items in the game do; you have to figure it out for yourself if you can't guess. It's incredibly dark and difficult to see, which may well be deliberate. It's very repetitive, mostly due to small variety in the monsters. I'm not sure why there are two bosses on each floor since you only seem to have to fight one to move on.

It's confusing and difficult to play, with nothing to really draw you in to stick with it. If you want a realtime roguelike, there are better entries in the genre.

Another ineresting element to the game is the money system, in which you collect coins to buy various upgrades that can alter your speed, health and jumping abaility among other things. Early Access Review

So I gave this game a review during Early Access and it was bad. Really bad. I have reconsidered my position after retrying the game a few months later when the game had more updates, features, achievements and now even cards and secondary weapons (ninja-to, ♥♥♥♥♥es!). It seems like devs are actually working on making this a better game.

It's not as bad as it used to be BUT I still dislike it. However, it do deserves a nice grade, this is just not my kind of game. The few classes you can choose are super unbalanced and it's a miracle if you can find a weapon that shoots actual bullets and not colorful balls of slugness or mega slow darts. Don't even let me get started on how super fast you die with any class that is not the heavy. I understand the mechanics of rogue-like dungeon crawlers and I have played a few, yes, but this one? You just die too fast.

If you have the patience for fast paced, rogue-like, one hit death, dubstep themed games, do give this a try. It won't hurt your pocket and you can even kill Poseidon! I just did!

reviewText: A decent game, to be sure, but there are other projects (Heavy Bullets, Fancy Skulls, etc.) that do the FPS roguelike in a more ambitious way; Paranautical Activity is essentially just a less loot-centered (which I find rather boring, frankly) Binding of Isaac FPS. Plus we were promised multiplayer but didn't recieve, which could be a testament to the Devs's ability to follow through on promises in future updates. All-in-all it's an entertaining game that I would recommend to players who enjoyed Doom, The Binding of Isaac or other games of that ilk, but aren't expecting anything truly pioneering.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

While others dislike this game because of the lack of updates and the poor feature discontinuation of the devlopers, I personally enjoy this game, although I am very very disapointed at their discontinuation of the multiplayer (Thats why you don't announce a feature until AFTER you confirm in your ability to be able to create it). From the very excellent gameplay to the fun and varied bosses that you encounter.
NOTE: This review will change as the game changes, this review is as of 1.8

PROS:

+ Classic FPS gameplay that you've come to love including Doom and Quake, with over 10 upgrades and fast paced action that many people crave, and NON REGENERATING HEALTH! YES!

+ The game is randomly generated and thus there are thousnads of possibilities for level layouts which is actually done really well, with every corner you turn being completley surprising. With over 50 differnt room enviroments its hard to see the same rooms twice on the same floor.

+ There are many different bosses that you encounter with over 10 in the game, each with their own moves which are pretty insane to watch, with balls of glowing lime green light flying everywhere as you attempt to dodge them with precise movement, just hoping it will die shortly.

+ Variety is a strong point in this game, with many many enemy types and each room having a random layout of enemy in every room, each enemy has its own attack patterns with ninjas that teleport to you in a blaze of white voxel blocks to sharks that dive into the floor leaching up onto you after they swim.

CONS: (Unfortinutley this game)

+ The music is boring a repedative with only a small handful of tracks that all sound the same.

+ The game has its fair share of glitches (Doors closing before you walk into them causing you to be stuck) But it is early access so I can cut it some slack

+ The developers have no clue what the hell they want in this game, from discontinuing multiplayer to saying updates would come quickly and sadly have come at a crawl.

+ The level's appearance doesnt change often enough (the first 5 levels use the same wall texture and gets bland and tidious after a while) And the bosses aren't really seen as bosses as nothing happens when you enter the room it just spawns and a health bar appears, a nice boss spawning track or some sound effects would really help.

+ Movement doesn't feel right, the lack of bobbing correctly to the very slow walking speed at the start doesn't work well with a game that depends on fast paced movement

OVERALL:
This game does have plenty of falws in it from glitches and the lazy developers but I keep coming back to this game, why? Because, its fun gameplay, great level layout and enemy variety really makes this game fun to me. I recomend only getting this game if it goes on sale in its current state, because currently it is a very fun game but there isn't enough variety from its very huge variety to make it worth it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a wonderful, devious game, made to emulate old school shooters like Quake Arena and Unreal Tournament. The setting of a sunken(?), haunted(?) Nazi ship is very unique, one which I've never seen before, and enemies are bizarre and in some cases disturbing.

I have yet to beat the game due to it's difficulty. It starts off nice and slow with giant demons and landsharks, but eventually you're fighting ninjas, flaming skulls, and numerous other creatures, each with their own attack patterns and annoying things you have to deal with about them.

There are 5 characters to pick from, each offering a different suite of pros and cons, and each with different playstyles. There's David Bowie, with his powerful crossbow and revolver, Dy-no-mite, with his short range arsenal of a grenade launcher and a katana, Giliad, with his fast firing machine gun and laser, my personal favorite, Gorton, wielding an immensely powerful sickle and a gun that shoots homing explosives, and finally the tank, who deals with how slow he is with massive amounts of health and astonishing firepower.

The gameplay is adrenal, not as much as something like Hotline Miami or Super Hexagon, but still very gripping and exciting, and I found myself physically tense several times while playing. Take this as a good or bad thing, but the game is intense for sure.

The powerups are many and varied, although it does not tell you what they do a lot of the time, and the enemies, as I stated before, can be simply chilling, especially the bosses. Going through that red door, I have faced everything from a floating skull with spiders pouring out of it's mouth to a nazi chainsaw murderer, all of which were tough in their own way. Some bosses have special items that you get when they die, and it makes you really happy when a boss with the item you need comes up. This being a roguelite, that might not happen often, as the levels are procedurally generated.

The game will throw a variety of non-enemy obstacles at you, making the game far more intense. These gamechangers include swinging blades, lava floors, and low light levels, which might not seem very hindering until it happens.

The voxel graphics may be a turn off for some, but I found that I liked them a lot most of the time, and it added a level of uniqueness in it's visuals, along with the amazing lightshow caused by the projectiles and some of the enemies in the darker levels, that made the game all the better.

There are a few things I dislike about this game, from getting stuck under stairs, some glitchyness, and a few annoying enemies, but this being an early access game, I expect that those will be ironed out at some point.

10/10 as an early access game, 9/10 as a full game.

reviewText:
Pros:
- Decent music
- Decent enemy variety
- Items and other stuff to find through out the dungeons
- OK boss fights

Cons:
- All of the weapons suck, usually difficult to aim or use, lack impact and are never multi-purpose. Trying to use any of the 4 main weapons to fight most of the enemies is a real challenge.
- Classes are pretty useless. They all seem to be extremes with only 1 balanced class. Other classes include, guy with 1 hp, guy who moves slower than a rock, guy with ultra useless weapon.
- Extremely repetitive locations. Every room is the same as the last and it's the same shade of blue most of the game.
- Floaty controls, the movement just feels wrong. View bobbing is annoying too.
- Colliding with oddly placed staircases and other pointless structures.

Overall:
I don't recommend this game. Each play session is so damn short it's ridiculous. No matter how many times i try and with any of the classes, I rarely make it to the 3rd floor. Often getting hit by things I can't even see or are unable to dodge with the slower classes. It lacks content, isn't very fun and gets very repetitive very quickly. Unless you like shooting the same enemies in the same rooms with the same 4 textures using awful weapons, stay away from this game. There are many better shooters out there. The roguelike elements aren't used in any interesting way here either. Just another excuse to stretch out a game's length when it otherwise lacks content and substance.

reviewText:
A bumping soundtrack and fast paced, hard hitting weapons with cool particle effects, a selection of weird bosses and a handful of surreal supernatural atmosphere all come together and make Paranautical Activity a make a great fast paced FPS Dungeon Crawler with roguelike elements that I still have fun blasting out a quick game or two in here and there.

Paranautical Activity began to pick up traction within the Steam community, but then went off the rails after one of the two developers went on a childish twitter rampage against Steam and had the game pulled after a comment about killing Gabe Newell[ http]/
Much like Fez, despite all the nonsense and bad publicity because of a developer, Paranautical Activity is still a pretty unique, adrenalin pumping fast blast of a game.

Highlights
* Excellent timing/pace and very quick off the mark
* Unique enemies and design
* One helluva Soundtrack

Mistakes
* There's a sentiment from Steam gamers to avoid this title because of the twitter comments and attitude of the former developer. While I personally think the former developer was a childish idiot, I separate my choice to purchase a product from any attitude or conceptions I have on people involved with the creation of a product. For some people the attitudes of people working for a company go hand in hand with their choice to purchase products from that company, and may take issue. However the the developers are no longer involved and the title has now near-completely changed hands.
* There are noticably too few enemies, and arguably a lack of weapons, which means gameplay becomes repetitive after long stretches.

Recommendations
Available on Steam for £6.99/8.99€/$9.99 at the time of review, which feels very fair. It's very replayable and I often find myself coming back to run through a quick few floors. It's often available cheaper via various Indie Bundles, so search around.

OK... this game is awesome

I really like this game.
The gameplay and controls are simple, its not like other games where the game forces a tutorial at you so you can learn the game. The fun thing is to learn about the game as you play.
The game is also challanging at some points, but that is a good thing for a game like this.

I like the weapons, I wish they would make more.
If you like the binding of Isaac then you are gonna live this game, there are very much alike

The issues that I have with  with this game is that it can be a bit slow at some points, because sometimes you have to go through many rooms that you have already cleared to buy items and get all the way back to the next floor

I recommend this game to people who likes fun and challanging games. This game is addictive and has a lot of replayabillity.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Although I have not gotten very far in the game (level 3), it is quite easy for me to say that it is a lot of fun.

Here are a few positive things I'd like to point out:
-Game mechanics are incredibly simple and easy to grasp
-Impressive enemy variety
-Weapons are fun and varied
-Power ups and stores offer many options for players
-Dungeon designs are varied
-Success is reliant on player skill
-Lighting effects are cool
-Art style is cool
-Music is cool, and fits the action
-HUD is unobtrusive and informative
-Boss, and mini-boss, battles are fun and creative
-Game is cool (haha)

Here are a couple negative things:
-No scoring system or scoreboards
-Only a few music tracks
-No achievements (not a neccesity, but it might be cool)

Overall I've had a lot of fun with the game so far, its easy to jump in and play for a bit. I am also quite excited for the co-op update.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nParanautical Activity is a game that is not unsimilar to a mixture of The Ace of Spades, Doom, and The Binding of Isaac. It is a pixelated, first-person shooter mixed into a roguelike game like TBOI. Each run is different, the levels are randomly generated, and there are numerous weapons to choose from. Also similar to TBOI, there are Shops in which you can buy powerups, new weapons, upgrades, etc. There are bosses at the end of each level, along with other mini-boss rooms that can be found on each level. Each of these give you a power-up, new weapon, boost, etc. that can help you throughout the game. Despite the game being rather Linear at times, it is a lot of fun to play, for it is both attention-grabbing, fast-paced and challenging. This game, if there were a star system on steam for players, would easily get an 8/10. I would highly recommend this game to anybody who likes fast-paced, roguelike FPS games.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is quite unique. It has a terrific soundtrack, retro/modern graphics combinedwith the rpg elements of choosing a character. The difficulty increases each time you move up a lvel in the elevator, which is good. Some of the enemies look like something out of doom, but then you have these random Jawas shooting fireballs at you and exploding dinosaurs. The bosses are even better, some so strange that you'll wonder where the inspiration for them came from. Another ineresting element to the game is the money system, in which you collect coins to buy various upgrades that can alter your speed, health and jumping abaility among other things. This game is great as it stands, but if you get it, somewhere along the lin co-op will be introduced, might be a long shot, but would only make it more fun.

reviewText: A decent game, to be sure, but there are other projects (Heavy Bullets, Fancy Skulls, etc.) that do the FPS roguelike in a more ambitious way; Paranautical Activity is essentially just a less loot-centered (which I find rather boring, frankly) Binding of Isaac FPS. Plus we were promised multiplayer but didn't recieve, which could be a testament to the Devs's ability to follow through on promises in future updates. All-in-all it's an entertaining game that I would recommend to players who enjoyed Doom, The Binding of Isaac or other games of that ilk, but aren't expecting anything truly pioneering.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

While others dislike this game because of the lack of updates and the poor feature discontinuation of the devlopers, I personally enjoy this game, although I am very very disapointed at their discontinuation of the multiplayer (Thats why you don't announce a feature until AFTER you confirm in your ability to be able to create it). From the very excellent gameplay to the fun and varied bosses that you encounter.
NOTE: This review will change as the game changes, this review is as of 1.8

PROS:

+ Classic FPS gameplay that you've come to love including Doom and Quake, with over 10 upgrades and fast paced action that many people crave, and NON REGENERATING HEALTH! YES!

+ The game is randomly generated and thus there are thousnads of possibilities for level layouts which is actually done really well, with every corner you turn being completley surprising. With over 50 differnt room enviroments its hard to see the same rooms twice on the same floor.

+ There are many different bosses that you encounter with over 10 in the game, each with their own moves which are pretty insane to watch, with balls of glowing lime green light flying everywhere as you attempt to dodge them with precise movement, just hoping it will die shortly.

+ Variety is a strong point in this game, with many many enemy types and each room having a random layout of enemy in every room, each enemy has its own attack patterns with ninjas that teleport to you in a blaze of white voxel blocks to sharks that dive into the floor leaching up onto you after they swim.

CONS: (Unfortinutley this game)

+ The music is boring a repedative with only a small handful of tracks that all sound the same.

+ The game has its fair share of glitches (Doors closing before you walk into them causing you to be stuck) But it is early access so I can cut it some slack

+ The developers have no clue what the hell they want in this game, from discontinuing multiplayer to saying updates would come quickly and sadly have come at a crawl.

+ The level's appearance doesnt change often enough (the first 5 levels use the same wall texture and gets bland and tidious after a while) And the bosses aren't really seen as bosses as nothing happens when you enter the room it just spawns and a health bar appears, a nice boss spawning track or some sound effects would really help.

+ Movement doesn't feel right, the lack of bobbing correctly to the very slow walking speed at the start doesn't work well with a game that depends on fast paced movement

OVERALL:
This game does have plenty of falws in it from glitches and the lazy developers but I keep coming back to this game, why? Because, its fun gameplay, great level layout and enemy variety really makes this game fun to me. I recomend only getting this game if it goes on sale in its current state, because currently it is a very fun game but there isn't enough variety from its very huge variety to make it worth it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have this game on Steam, and I really enjoy it. Here's a breakdown of the short while I've been playing it.

PROS
- Fast-paced do-or-die action gameplay
- Variety of weapons and classes (recently updated and balanced, every class now also has a secondary weapon)
- Variety of enemies (recently updated with a rocket turtle :D)
- Recently updated free weapon" door (you'll see when you play)

CONS
- You can get stuck under stairs (a pain
date: given you only have a few hits and no recovery time between hits)\n- Some boss doors have pentagrams (a moral preference)\n- Some bosses seem unbeatable based on your class (some you need to outrun
hoursPlayed:
but the Tank class is too slow)

NEUTRAL (Pro or Con based on preference)
- Unoriginal cubed "Minecraft" look
- Can't change the music (I happen to like some songs. I've heard by others that they are obnoxious)

TIPS
- Don't stop moving
- Try out all the classes for their weapons to see if you like them before you buy replacements in the gift shop
- Don't underestimate those little dudes... they are surpisingly accurate."

reviewText:
- Very poorly optimized
- Some rooms are exact duplicates of another, monsters and their starting locations included.
- Seemingly no goal, just go from room to room killing monsters.
- Little challenge. The monsters aim with the fireball things is poorly designed. It seems like they just shoot in the direction you are at the moment they fire it. It is easy to avoid being hit by walking in a circle around the room and shooting the enemies while doing so.
- Poor options design. The only way to change screen resolution or graphics quality is by closing the game and changing the settings in the launcher which opens when you start the game. You cannot view/edit the controls in-game (You must change or view them in the launcher).
- Non-standard weapon switching buttons or [Use] key, so you should look at the controls before you play.
- Poor special effects.
- Colours are dark and dull. It seems like very few different colours were used.

I would not advise buying this game at all. I can not comment on a reasonable price as this seems like it is incomplete for a modern game. I feel like I have experienced everything this game has to offer in the 12 minutes I have actually played as it is fast paced (Which is one of the only good things about this game) and had forced myself to continue playing it past the 6th minute in order to be able to feel like this review was justified, in those extra 6 minutes my opinion of the game only worsened.

I got this in an Indie Gala bundle, this not being the reason I had bought the bundle so the price of this was not being taken into consideration for the review.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: Oh boy this game. Originally taken down due to ♥♥♥♥♥♥  devs, and reuploaded for god knows what reason. I purchased this game when there was a rouge-like sale going on, and even though it was only about $2.50, I regret it. Now, before I go one, I have to preface this by saying that I played the Tank 99% of the time. I greatly enjoy heavy characters, and From the stats I thought I would enjoy playing as him the most. I did, as the others were ♥♥♥♥. However, whenever the Tank fires his shotgun, theres a full second of the game registering the damage or if it hit or whatever, where the game entirely freezes up. This mostly happens on larger enemies, but it makes the game utterly unplayable due to it. You stop, and the game doesnt. Id be fine with this if it was purposefully implemented, but its clearly not as when you attack smaller enemies or hit with fewer pellets, the game doesnt freeze. The cannon on the other hand is completely worthless even without a glitch, not that it doesnt have one. When firing the cannon, sometimes there will be a visible projectile but sometimes there wont be a charge up time OR a projectile, just immediately dealing damage to whatevers in front of you. It makes the gun entirely unpredictable, which is not a good thing in a game about avoiding death. Bomb's usefulness varies from very good against slower enemies, to absolutely worthless on bosses and slightly faster enemies. A major MAJOR problem in the game, however, is the fact that not every class can beat every boss. While playing as the slow Tank, I encountered a snail-like boss that immediately curled up and unrelentingly rolled at me, much faster than I could move out of its path while it immediately snaps to wherever I run, making the entire fight a DPS race which is NOT A GOOD THING. It might be that I just didnt figure out some secret strategy of beating it, but that's a moot point. There is no point in making a game unplayable just for the sake of difficulty.\nThere's some good things about the game, for as much as Im harshing on it: The concept of an FPS Roguelike is a very fun one that has tons of potential, of which they use none. The graphics are very adorable, giving even what are supposed to be hideous monsters a very huggable and blocky appearance. It is an overused artstyle, but I have a weakness for it and enjoy when it is used.\nAlso the music is ♥♥♥♥ing terrible.

reviewText:
An epic FPS roguelike, that is definitely worth your time.
The bosses are difficult enough to be challenging, but not overbearing,
the weapons, and items make for an entertaining bit of chance, (some items suck, some rock,)
the randomly generated levels give tons of replay value, (as does any roguelike that's worth it's salt,)
and despite one of the devs saying he was gonna kill Gaben, and losing his job, and the game being removed, etc.
the game is back on Steam, and updated, and better than before! :D Yay!
The devs have kept up on this since Early Access, and it shows in the finished product.
Definitely worth $10, let alone the sale prices.

reviewText: I really want to reccommend this game, but the bad just ended up outweighing the good. Is it a fun game? I'd say so. It's fast paced, action-packed and the graphics are surprisingly unique. However, there's just too much I personally don't enjoy for me to keep playing. I'm all for hard games, but in some parts, the difficulty spikes in unfair ways. I'm not even talking about the bosses, which, while cliche (flying skulls? really?), are fun and pleasantly challenging. I'm referring to enemies like the land sharks that are nearly impossible to hit and can grind your health away in seconds after noiselessly charging you in packs of 5 or 6. Another issue I had was the item system. Some items, when activated, seem to do absolutely nothing. I'm sure they were performing some function, but some feedback or even a short bio displayed when picking up the item would have been appreciated. Also why does the sword use ammo? That's nitpicking, I'll admit, but something just seems odd about that to me, especially since it appears to be just a standard medieval sword. While fun, Paranautical Activity doesn't really enough to keep me playing for more than half an hour or so.\n\nScore: 5/10

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is quite unique. It has a terrific soundtrack, retro/modern graphics combinedwith the rpg elements of choosing a character. The difficulty increases each time you move up a lvel in the elevator, which is good. Some of the enemies look like something out of doom, but then you have these random Jawas shooting fireballs at you and exploding dinosaurs. The bosses are even better, some so strange that you'll wonder where the inspiration for them came from. Another ineresting element to the game is the money system, in which you collect coins to buy various upgrades that can alter your speed, health and jumping abaility among other things. This game is great as it stands, but if you get it, somewhere along the lin co-op will be introduced, might be a long shot, but would only make it more fun.

reviewText:
A great rouge-like game. Mixes ideas from Binding of Isaac with first person shooters that has a Quake/Doom feel to it. The replayability isnt too great at the moment (This review is being written while it is in early access.) Also The devs have mentioned they are working on multiplayer co-op and are also going to be adding a ton of new content. I have yet to beat this game but it sure does provide a challenge in the later levels. (Things crawling on the walls, projectiles everywhere, etc.) I would say this game is worth buying. It's really fun and quite a challenge and i'm sure once the Multiplayer co-op with all the new content is released it will be even better. I'd give it a 8/10 because there are some minor flaws such as it needs more content (Items to be exact, maybe more weapons aswell. Not to mention maybe some more room layouts.) but other than that it's a great game and I highly reccommend giving it a go.

After Early Access edit: Well, the old developers went completely haywire and did some stupid stuff, but now there's a completely new owner and hopefully they take the game in the right direction. My old review still stands as it is still pretty fun to play.

2nd edit: The new devs have done absolutley nothing. This game is just a mess.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Paranautical Activity is an excellent roguelike dungeon-crawling shooter, with simple humbling textures, and a charming implementation of voxels. This game's satisfaction, consisting of fighting off hordes of demonspawn, and cracking open phat lewts is only matched by that of the speed and finesse the player as they weave and blast their way through randomly generated rooms. All set to a spicy hardcore techno beat, valliantly played through the entire game.
In addition to promised future updates, Paranautical Activity is absolutely worth the purchase to support its development. I personally await anxiously to play this game again in the future when I have a computer with enough hardware capacity to play this game without strong lag.

8/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you throw Binding Of Isaac, Quake and Minecraft into a blender, you would get Paranautical Acitivty.

Even in and early state, this game is a lot of fun but clearly lacking features.

You start the game choosing presets of weapons, so far I prefer the shotgun although you dont get a secondary weapon and it is slow, so it has its cons.

It uses a similar random room system as Binding Of Isaac which helps keep the game from feeling non linear, In its current state you will be facing the same type of enemy a lot.
So far I have seen maybe 4 or 5 types of enemies excluding boss battles.

It controls like a twitch shooter like the early days of quake, and gaining powerups to double jump etc. adds a lot of fun jumping and dodging bullets around the rooms.

The minecraft esque graphics look beautiful with a great lighting system. When you destroy enemies and explosive barrel's you will see a lot of 'particle' like effects which look great.

In its current state I would give this game a 6/10, I have not read about the upcoming features but this could easily be a 7 or 8/10 game when it is completed.

reviewText:
A great rouge-like game. Mixes ideas from Binding of Isaac with first person shooters that has a Quake/Doom feel to it. The replayability isnt too great at the moment (This review is being written while it is in early access.) Also The devs have mentioned they are working on multiplayer co-op and are also going to be adding a ton of new content. I have yet to beat this game but it sure does provide a challenge in the later levels. (Things crawling on the walls, projectiles everywhere, etc.) I would say this game is worth buying. It's really fun and quite a challenge and i'm sure once the Multiplayer co-op with all the new content is released it will be even better. I'd give it a 8/10 because there are some minor flaws such as it needs more content (Items to be exact, maybe more weapons aswell. Not to mention maybe some more room layouts.) but other than that it's a great game and I highly reccommend giving it a go.

After Early Access edit: Well, the old developers went completely haywire and did some stupid stuff, but now there's a completely new owner and hopefully they take the game in the right direction. My old review still stands as it is still pretty fun to play.

2nd edit: The new devs have done absolutley nothing. This game is just a mess.

reviewText:
Disregarding the controversy with the original dev: Is this a good game?

Yes, one of the first to explore the Roguelite FPS this game still stands up to other games in this sub genre.

I had to fiddle with the FOV till I found something comfortable but once that was sorted out I was having a blast.. Sucking terribly but still. Pretty fun. For me the real selling point is the soundtrack, nothing beats rocking out and blasting something to bits.

Definitely worth picking up on sale.

reviewText: An FPS roguelike that takes a lot of inspiration from Binding of Isaac. There is far less depth in terms of item synergy, item creativity, and strategy, but this is a fun game. The level design is good, the graphical style is simple and effective, and monsters all have distinctive designs and attack patterns. Most importantly though, firing weapons in this game just feels really damn good.\n\nIn conclusion: If you ever wanted to see The Binding of Isaac done as an FPS, this is the closest you can get as far as I know.

People say that the game is unfinished and isn't that good but I say try to maybe support the developer(s) in any way possible so this game could be more popular and fun! So I do recommend this game but I say come into this game with an open mind. P.S. The game is like a mix of The Binding Of Isaac & Legend Of Dungeon except its in first person."

voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
Pros:
- Decent music
- Decent enemy variety
- Items and other stuff to find through out the dungeons
- OK boss fights

Cons:
- All of the weapons suck, usually difficult to aim or use, lack impact and are never multi-purpose. Trying to use any of the 4 main weapons to fight most of the enemies is a real challenge.
- Classes are pretty useless. They all seem to be extremes with only 1 balanced class. Other classes include, guy with 1 hp, guy who moves slower than a rock, guy with ultra useless weapon.
- Extremely repetitive locations. Every room is the same as the last and it's the same shade of blue most of the game.
- Floaty controls, the movement just feels wrong. View bobbing is annoying too.
- Colliding with oddly placed staircases and other pointless structures.

Overall:
I don't recommend this game. Each play session is so damn short it's ridiculous. No matter how many times i try and with any of the classes, I rarely make it to the 3rd floor. Often getting hit by things I can't even see or are unable to dodge with the slower classes. It lacks content, isn't very fun and gets very repetitive very quickly. Unless you like shooting the same enemies in the same rooms with the same 4 textures using awful weapons, stay away from this game. There are many better shooters out there. The roguelike elements aren't used in any interesting way here either. Just another excuse to stretch out a game's length when it otherwise lacks content and substance.

reviewText: I don't see why so many people rated this great game negatively. I find it very fun to spend about 30 minutes to an hour on then come back to it later. Very fast paced gameplay, great music, and well-implemented items and achievements. Please don't let the previous developer influence your decision; this game is really good and definitely worth the money when it is on sale like it is now. Highly Recommend.

I find that the game that you can actually play itself is really fun and interesting and amazing. But I keep crashing so until I either 100% it's gonna keep doing this. If you're not on a mac like me I recommend this. If you are on a mac. If you're able to fix this problem. Well better for you.
